com.terei.jvector.paint
Class PaintCanvas

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.terei.jvector.paint.PaintCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible
public class PaintCanvas
extends JPanel
implements MouseListener, MouseMotionListener

Provides The actual 'paint canvas' a JPanel that the user interacts with directly to draw shapes. This class passes on the draw commands to lower subclasses, and displays the results. This is the GUI frontend.

Since:
24/04/2004
Version:
1
Author:
David Terei
See Also:
Serialized Form

                   int width,
                   int height,
                   PaintTab tab)
Create a new PaintCanvas.

Parameters:
name - The name of the Image this paint canvas will manage.
width - The width of the Image this paint canvas will manage.
height - The height of the Image this paint canvas will manage.
tab - The PaintTab that holds this image.

PaintCanvas

public PaintCanvas(String name,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   int zoom,
                   PaintTab tab,
                   Shape[] shapes)
Create a new PaintCanvas, with some pre-existing shpes.

Parameters:
name - The name of the Image this paint canvas will manage.
width - The width of the Image this paint canvas will manage.
height - The height of the Image this paint canvas will manage.
zoom - The zoom of the image.
shapes - The pre-existing shapes to add to the image this paint canvas will manage.
tab - The PaintTab that holds this image.

isSaved

public boolean isSaved()
If the 'graphic' has been saved or not. This will return false even if the graphic has been saved, if it has been modified since that point.

So this really returns if the currently viewed graphic has been saved.

Returns:
Returns the saved state of the 'graphic.'

notifySaved

public void notifySaved()
Notfiy the 'graphic' that it has been saved.

revalidateZoom

public void revalidateZoom()
Refreshes the paint canvas, by telling it to zoom to its current size. This method should be called if there are some problems with images not resizing properly (not when zooming, but other operations).

zoom

private void zoom(int percent,
                  Point p)
Zooms in or out of the canvas.

Parameters:
percent - The percentage for the zoom to be.
p - The point to zoom in on.

resizeView

private void resizeView(double nz,
                        Point p)
Resizes the view area, used when zooming.

Parameters:
nz - The percentage in decimal form to resize it to relative to its 100% value.
p - The point to center in on.

resizeShapes

private void resizeShapes(double d)
Resizes all the shapes, used when zooming.

Parameters:
d - The percentage in decimal form to resize it to relative to its 100% value.
